question: Oliver has a bag of buttons with 76 inside. He tripped over a toy while carrying it and dropped one quarter of them. He scrambled to search for them but only came up with 15. When he went back home, he inspected the buttons further. Seven of the ones he picked up weren't buttons, but actually beads so he got rid of them. How many buttons did Oliver end up with?
answer:
Oliver dropped his buttons and was left with 76*3/4=<<76*3/4=57>>57 buttons.
He searched and found some of his lost buttons, getting him back to 57+15=<<57+15=72>>72 buttons.
He went home and removed seven beads, leaving him with 72-7=<<72-7=65>>65 buttons.
#### 65
